name: Mother Of Thousands
climate: Prefers warm tropical climates similar to its native habitat.
Can tolerate dry conditions, but thrives with some humidity.
Not cold-hardy, so it should be kept away from frost.
Indoor climates are suitable if they mimic its natural warmth.
sunlight: Requires bright, indirect sunlight for best growth.
Can withstand some direct sunlight but avoid midday harsh sun.
In inadequate light, plant may become leggy and sparse.
Best placed near a window with filtered sunlight exposure.
watering: Needs moderate watering during the growing season.
Let the soil dry out between waterings to prevent rot.
Water sparingly in the winter months when growth slows.
Ensure proper drainage to avoid waterlogging roots.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil to keep roots healthy and dry.
A cactus or succulent mix is ideal to support its growth.
Avoid dense, clay soils that retain too much moisture.
Amend soil with sand or perlite to improve drainage.
toxic: Toxic to pets, including cats and dogs, if ingested.
Contains compounds that can cause nausea and vomiting.
extra_care_tip: Remove plantlets to control spread and promote healthy growth.
Prune dead or damaged leaves to maintain plant appearance.
